activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:15 PM Defendant Thomas P Gordon in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Jean Smith in court for Thomas P Gordon.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright  in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Smith relates, reading waived, not guilty pleas entered to all counts.  Attorney Smith relates discovery has not yet been received. State relates.  Status hearing set for 12/16/2022 at 9:00 AM. Bond continues.

1:10 PM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas P Gordon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Knaak appears by video for Defendant for today only for purposes of bail.  Warrant quashed.  State relates and requests cash bond now.  1:12 p.m. Defendant and Attorney Knaak put in break-out room to discuss bond. 1:16 p.m. back on the record.  Attorney Knaak requests that the previous signature bond be reinstated or a low cash bond set.  Court relates Defendant may not have gotten Notice of Hearing in time and why Warrant was issued so signature bond is reinstated.  CLERK TO SEND NOH TO DEFENDANT IN JAIL AFTER COURT.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas P Gordon not in court. 
This was scheduled at 10 AM. The defendant contacted the Clerk's of Court's and indicated he would be on his way at 11:00 AM. Defendant still does not appear. 
Court issues a bench warrant - body only Wisconsin and adjacent states.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

1:01 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas P Gordon appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Thomas P Gordon for today only. 
Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney.  Court questions defendant.  Address and phone number confirmed.  AIA set and MUST APPEAR IN PERSON.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
